chart_description: This chart displays the rate of interrupts received by the CPU over time. Interrupts are messages sent to the CPU by hardware devices requesting its attention.

dimension_descriptions.10: Number of interrupts caused by the system timer (IRQ0)
dimension_descriptions.15: Number of interrupts caused by the secondary ATA channel
dimension_descriptions.25: Number of interrupts caused by the network interface card (NIC)
dimension_descriptions.26: Number of interrupts caused by the storage adapter
dimension_descriptions.27: Number of interrupts caused by the graphics card
dimension_descriptions.28: Number of interrupts caused by the sound card
dimension_descriptions.29: Number of interrupts caused by the USB controller
dimension_descriptions.30: Number of interrupts caused by the keyboard
dimension_descriptions.31: Number of interrupts caused by the mouse
dimension_descriptions.32: Number of interrupts caused by the co-processor
dimension_descriptions.33: Number of interrupts caused by the primary ATA channel
dimension_descriptions.34: Number of interrupts caused by the floppy disk drive controller
dimension_descriptions.35: Number of interrupts caused by the serial ports
dimension_descriptions.36: Number of interrupts caused by the parallel ports
dimension_descriptions.37: Number of interrupts caused by the real-time clock (RTC)
dimension_descriptions.38: Number of interrupts caused by the ACPI system
dimension_descriptions.39: Number of interrupts caused by the system management interrupt (SMI)
dimension_descriptions.55: Number of interrupts caused by other devices
dimension_descriptions.56: Number of interrupts caused by software
dimension_descriptions.CAL: Number of interrupts caused by kernel calibration timers
dimension_descriptions.LOC: Number of interrupts caused by the local APIC
dimension_descriptions.RES: Number of interrupts caused by the APIC Bus Resend
dimension_descriptions.TLB: Number of interrupts caused by the TLB flush
